citations.narrative:
At time of inspection, facility property was accessible for inspector review, except when a second staff member was not
available to open the controlled drug cabinet that requires 2 different keys to access. Not allowing full access to APHIS
officials to inspect property hinders their ability to enforce standards in the Animal Welfare Act. Each research facility
shall, during business hours, allow APHIS officials to inspect parts of facilities they feel necessary to enforce the
provisions of the Act.
Correct from this date forward of 12 July 2023.

At time of inspection, the facility representative stated that the contingency plan had not been reviewed since 2020.
Failing to review the contingency plan on a regular basis may lead to outdated and incorrect information resulting in
animal injury during emergencies. The registrant must review the contingency plan on at least an annual basis and
maintain documentation thereof, including any changes made to the plan.
Correct by documenting review of the contingency plan by 11 August 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.38(b)(1)(iv) 
   
Miscellaneous. 
At time of inspection, facility property was accessible for inspector review, except when a second staff member was not 
available to open the controlled drug cabinet that requires 2 different keys to access. Not allowing full access to APHIS 
officials to inspect property hinders their ability to enforce standards in the Animal Welfare Act. Each research facility 
shall, during business hours, allow APHIS officials to inspect parts of facilities they feel necessary to enforce the 
provisions of the Act.  
 
Correct from this date forward of 12 July 2023. 
2.38(l)(2) 
   
Miscellaneous. 
At time of inspection, the facility representative stated that the contingency plan had not been reviewed since 2020. 
Failing to review the contingency plan on a regular basis may lead to outdated and incorrect information resulting in 
animal injury during emergencies. The registrant must review the contingency plan on at least an annual basis and 
maintain documentation thereof, including any changes made to the plan. 
 
Correct by documenting review of the contingency plan by 11 August 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
